articles.headline: Uber Aims for an Edge in the Race for a Self-Driving Future
articles.snippet: The company said it had acquired a start-up comprising former Google and Carnegie Mellon engineers, as well as announced a partnership with Volvo to test self-driving cars on Pittsburgh streets in a matter of weeks.
articles.abstract: The company said it had acquired a start-up comprising former Google and Carnegie Mellon engineers, as well as announced a partnership with Volvo to test self-driving cars on Pittsburgh streets in a matter of weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: A world in which cars drive themselves may come sooner than once thought.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Secrecy of Settlements at Fox News Hid Bad Behavior
articles.snippet: These agreements impose silence on sexual harassment victims to protect the company, but this fosters the perception that they are really cover-ups.
articles.abstract: These agreements impose silence on sexual harassment victims to protect the company, but this fosters the perception that they are really cover-ups.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like many companies confronted with sexual harassment in their executive ranks, Fox News and its parent, 21st Century Fox, say they do not tolerate such behavior and have strict policies prohibiting it.

articles.headline: Republicans Worry a Falling Donald Trump Tide Will Lower All Boats
articles.snippet: Party officials and strategists fear that Mr. Trump is in such danger that even their best-prepared candidates will not be able to withstand the impact.
articles.abstract: Party officials and strategists fear that Mr. Trump is in such danger that even their best-prepared candidates will not be able to withstand the impact.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s struggling candidacy has now become a direct threat to Republican control of Congress, significantly increasing the likelihood that Democrats will take control of the Senate and cut substantially into the House Republican majority next year.

articles.headline: Fight for Viacom Is Said to End With the Redstones in Control
articles.snippet: A truce has been reached in the vicious corporate battle that pitted the 93-year-old mogul and his daughter against his longtime confidants and directors at Viacom.
articles.abstract: A truce has been reached in the vicious corporate battle that pitted the 93-year-old mogul and his daughter against his longtime confidants and directors at Viacom.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fight over Sumner M. Redstone’s $40 billion media empire is over, and the 93-year-old mogul has won.

articles.headline: Middle-Income Jobs Finally Show Signs of a Rebound
articles.snippet: A Federal Reserve Bank of New York analysis suggests this may signal a turnabout in a long but lackluster economic recovery.
articles.abstract: A Federal Reserve Bank of New York analysis suggests this may signal a turnabout in a long but lackluster economic recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American economy is finally creating more middle-income jobs, according to a new analysis released Thursday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, in a turnabout from the feast-and-famine pattern earlier in the recovery, when hiring was strongest at the bottom and top of the wage scale.

articles.headline: U.S. Concedes $400 Million Payment to Iran Was Delayed as Prisoner ‘Leverage’
articles.snippet: The State Department said the payment was to settle an old dispute and did not amount to a “ransom” for the release of three American prisoners.
articles.abstract: The State Department said the payment was to settle an old dispute and did not amount to a “ransom” for the release of three American prisoners.
articles.lead_paragraph: The State Department conceded for the first time on Thursday that it delayed making a $400 million payment to Iran for several hours in January “to retain maximum leverage” and ensure that three American prisoners were released the same day.

articles.headline: Exxon Mobil Fraud Inquiry Said to Focus More on Future Than Past
articles.snippet: Eric T. Schneiderman of New York said the investigation was concentrating on issues like the value the company puts on oil still in the ground.
articles.abstract: Eric T. Schneiderman of New York said the investigation was concentrating on issues like the value the company puts on oil still in the ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a year, much of the public scrutiny of Exxon Mobil was captured by the #Exxonknew hashtag — shorthand for revelations about decades-old research on climate change conducted by the company while it funded groups promoting doubt about climate science.

articles.headline: These Airlines Are Making It Easier to Share Miles
articles.snippet: A few smaller airlines are helping customers earn free seats many times faster than they used to, and without charging them for the privilege.
articles.abstract: A few smaller airlines are helping customers earn free seats many times faster than they used to, and without charging them for the privilege.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is nearly a given in the world of loyalty programs that things can only get worse. Every change that a travel company or a retailer refers to as an enhancement, it seems, will actually mean that you earn fewer points, need more of them to earn rewards, or have less flexibility in redeeming them.

articles.headline: Paul Manafort Quits Donald Trump’s Campaign After a Tumultuous Run
articles.snippet: Mr. Manafort leaves nearly a week after a report about problems within the Republican nominee’s campaign helped precipitate a leadership shake-up.
articles.abstract: Mr. Manafort leaves nearly a week after a report about problems within the Republican nominee’s campaign helped precipitate a leadership shake-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: Paul Manafort, a professional Republican political operative since the 1970s, was supposed to impose order on Donald J. Trump’s chaotic presidential campaign.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin
